intro: Anadenia trifida, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces bright orange or yellow berries that contain the seeds. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Anadenia trifida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm climates.
